AMZN.chat_gpt: Amazon.com, Inc. will benefit from increased online sales of golf equipment and apparel.
AMZN.claude: Amazon.com, Inc. sells a wide range of golf equipment, apparel, and accessories through its e-commerce platform. As golf participation increases, Amazon could benefit from higher sales of golf-related products.

DE.chat_gpt: Deere & Company, through its John Deere brand, supplies golf course maintenance equipment, benefiting from increased golf course activity.

DIS.chat_gpt: The Walt Disney Company, through its ESPN network, will benefit from broadcasting more golf events.
DIS.claude: The Walt Disney Company owns ESPN, which broadcasts golf tournaments and provides golf-related content. As golf gains popularity, ESPN could benefit from increased viewership and advertising revenue from its golf coverage.

GOLF.chat_gpt: Acushnet Holdings Corp, the parent company of Titleist and FootJoy, stands to gain from higher demand for golf balls, clubs, and apparel.
GOLF.claude: Acushnet Holdings Corp. is a leading golf equipment and apparel company, owning brands such as Titleist and FootJoy. The company's focus on premium golf products and its strong brand recognition make it a potential beneficiary of the golf boom.

LULU.claude: Lululemon Athletica is a premium athletic apparel company that has recently entered the golf market with its golf-specific clothing line. The company's focus on comfort, performance, and style could resonate with the growing number of golfers.
